section.title: git reset
section.para:
The History view allows you to reset your current branch to a commit. Right-click on a certain commit and select
Reset
and the reset mode you would like to use.

section.title: Finding "invisible" commits with the Reflog view
section.para: Commits are not visible in the Git history if they can't be reached from a branch or tag. This might happen during a reset, commit amend or rebase operation. By default, such invisible commits are removed after two weeks by the Git system.

The Git Reflog view keeps track of the movements of the HEAD pointer and the movements of each branch. This view allows you to find a commit again, e.g., if you used the git reset --hard command to remove certain commits.
